basal cell.definition: type of stem cell found in the stratum basale and in the hair matrix that continually undergoes cell division, producing the keratinocytes of the epidermis

basal cell carcinoma.definition: cancer that originates from basal cells in the epidermis of the skin

bedsore.definition: sore on the skin that develops when regions of the body start necrotizing due to constant pressure and lack of blood supply; also called decubitis ulcers

callus.definition: thickened area of skin that arises due to constant abrasion

catagen.definition: transitional phase marking the end of the anagen phase of the hair growth cycle

corn.definition: type of callus that is named for its shape and the elliptical motion of the abrasive force

cortex.definition: in hair, the second or middle layer of keratinocytes originating from the hair matrix, as seen in a cross-section of the hair bulb

cuticle.definition: in hair, the outermost layer of keratinocytes originating from the hair matrix, as seen in a cross-section of the hair bulb

dermal papilla.definition: (plural = dermal papillae) extension of the papillary layer of the dermis that increases surface contact between the epidermis and dermis

dermis.definition: layer of skin between the epidermis and hypodermis, composed mainly of connective tissue and containing blood vessels, hair follicles, sweat glands, and other structures

desmosome.definition: structure that forms an impermeable junction between cells

eccrine sweat gland.definition: type of sweat gland that is common throughout the skin surface; it produces a hypotonic sweat for thermoregulation

eczema.definition: skin condition due to an allergic reaction, which resembles a rash

elastin fibers.definition: fibers made of the protein elastin that increase the elasticity of the dermis

eleiden.definition: clear protein-bound lipid found in the stratum lucidum that is derived from keratohyalin and helps to prevent water loss

epidermis.definition: outermost tissue layer of the skin

eponychium.definition: nail fold that meets the proximal end of the nail body, also called the cuticle

external root sheath.definition: outer layer of the hair follicle that is an extension of the epidermis, which encloses the hair root

first-degree burn.definition: superficial burn that injures only the epidermis

fourth-degree burn.definition: burn in which full thickness of the skin and underlying muscle and bone is damaged

glassy membrane.definition: the basement membrane that is found between the epithelium of the external root sheath and the connective tissue sheath

hair.definition: keratinous filament growing out of the epidermis

hair bulb.definition: structure at the base of the hair root that surrounds the dermal papilla

hair follicle.definition: cavity or sac from which hair originates

hair matrix.definition: layer of basal cells from which a strand of hair grows

hair papilla.definition: mass of connective tissue, blood capillaries, and nerve endings at the base of the hair follicle

hair root.definition: part of hair that is below the epidermis anchored to the follicle

hair shaft.definition: part of hair that is above the epidermis but is not anchored to the follicle

hypodermis.definition: connective tissue connecting the integument to the underlying bone and muscle

hyponychium.definition: thickened layer of stratum corneum that lies below the free edge of the nail

internal root sheath.definition: innermost layer of keratinocytes in the hair follicle that surround the hair root up to the hair shaft

keloid.definition: type of scar that has layers raised above the skin surface

keratin.definition: type of structural protein that gives skin, hair, and nails its hard, water-resistant properties

keratinocyte.definition: cell that produces keratin and is the most predominant type of cell found in the epidermis

keratohyalin.definition: granulated protein found in the stratum granulosum

Langerhans cell.definition: specialized dendritic cell found in the stratum spinosum that functions as a macrophage

lunula.definition: basal part of the nail body that consists of a crescent-shaped layer of thick epithelium

medulla.definition: in hair, the innermost layer of keratinocytes originating from the hair matrix

Meissner corpuscle.definition: (also, tactile corpuscle) receptor in the skin that responds to light touch

melanin.definition: pigment that determines the color of hair and skin

melanocyte.definition: cell found in the stratum basale of the epidermis that produces the pigment melanin

melanoma.definition: type of skin cancer that originates from the melanocytes of the skin

melanosome.definition: intercellular vesicle that transfers melanin from melanocytes into keratinocytes of the epidermis

Merkel cell.definition: receptor cell in the stratum basale of the epidermis that responds to the sense of touch

metastasis.definition: spread of cancer cells from a source to other parts of the body

nail bed.definition: layer of epidermis upon which the nail body forms

nail body.definition: main keratinous plate that forms the nail

nail cuticle.definition: fold of epithelium that extends over the nail bed, also called the eponychium

nail fold.definition: fold of epithelium at that extend over the sides of the nail body, holding it in place

nail root.definition: part of the nail that is lodged deep in the epidermis from which the nail grows

Pacinian corpuscle.definition: (also, lamellated corpuscle) receptor in the skin that responds to vibration

papillary layer.definition: superficial layer of the dermis, made of loose, areolar connective tissue

reticular layer.definition: deeper layer of the dermis; it has a reticulated appearance due to the presence of abundant collagen and elastin fibers

rickets.definition: disease in children caused by vitamin D deficiency, which leads to the weakening of bones

scar.definition: collagen-rich skin formed after the process of wound healing that is different from normal skin

sebaceous gland.definition: type of oil gland found in the dermis all over the body and helps to lubricate and waterproof the skin and hair by secreting sebum

sebum.definition: oily substance that is composed of a mixture of lipids that lubricates the skin and hair

second-degree burn.definition: partial-thickness burn that injures the epidermis and a portion of the dermis

squamous cell carcinoma.definition: type of skin cancer that originates from the stratum spinosum of the epidermis

stratum basale.definition: deepest layer of the epidermis, made of epidermal stem cells

stratum corneum.definition: most superficial layer of the epidermis

stratum granulosum.definition: layer of the epidermis superficial to the stratum spinosum

stratum lucidum.definition: layer of the epidermis between the stratum granulosum and stratum corneum, found only in thick skin covering the palms, soles of the feet, and digits

stratum spinosum.definition: layer of the epidermis superficial to the stratum basale, characterized by the presence of desmosomes

stretch mark.definition: mark formed on the skin due to a sudden growth spurt and expansion of the dermis beyond its elastic limits

telogen.definition: resting phase of the hair growth cycle initiated with catagen and terminated by the beginning of a new anagen phase of hair growth

third-degree burn.definition: burn that penetrates and destroys the full thickness of the skin (epidermis and dermis)

vitamin D.definition: compound that aids absorption of calcium and phosphates in the intestine to improve bone health

vitiligo.definition: skin condition in which melanocytes in certain areas lose the ability to produce melanin, possibly due an autoimmune reaction that leads to loss of color in patches

articular cartilage.definition: thin layer of cartilage covering an epiphysis; reduces friction and acts as a shock absorber

bone.definition: hard, dense connective tissue that forms the structural elements of the skeleton

canaliculi.definition: (singular = canaliculus) channels within the bone matrix that house one of an osteocyteâs many cytoplasmic extensions that it uses to communicate and receive nutrients

cartilage.definition: semi-rigid connective tissue found on the skeleton in areas where flexibility and smooth surfaces support movement

central canal.definition: longitudinal channel in the center of each osteon; contains blood vessels, nerves, and lymphatic vessels; also known as the Haversian canal

closed reduction.definition: manual manipulation of a broken bone to set it into its natural position without surgery

compact bone.definition: dense osseous tissue that can withstand compressive forces

diaphysis.definition: tubular shaft that runs between the proximal and distal ends of a long bone

diplo\u00c3\u00ab.definition: layer of spongy bone, that is sandwiched between the two layers of compact bone found in flat bones

endochondral ossification.definition: process in which bone forms by replacing hyaline cartilage

endosteum.definition: delicate membranous lining of a boneâs medullary cavity

epiphyseal line.definition: completely ossified remnant of the epiphyseal plate

epiphyseal plate.definition: (also, growth plate) sheet of hyaline cartilage in the metaphysis of an immature bone; replaced by bone tissue as the organ grows in length

epiphysis.definition: wide section at each end of a long bone; filled with spongy bone and red marrow

external callus.definition: collar of hyaline cartilage and bone that forms around the outside of a fracture

flat bone.definition: thin and curved bone; serves as a point of attachment for muscles and protects internal organs

fracture hematoma.definition: blood clot that forms at the site of a broken bone

hematopoiesis.definition: production of blood cells, which occurs in the red marrow of the bones

hole.definition: opening or depression in a bone

hypercalcemia.definition: condition characterized by abnormally high levels of calcium

hypocalcemia.definition: condition characterized by abnormally low levels of calcium

internal callus.definition: fibrocartilaginous matrix, in the endosteal region, between the two ends of a broken bone

intramembranous ossification.definition: process by which bone forms directly from mesenchymal tissue

irregular bone.definition: bone of complex shape; protects internal organs from compressive forces

lacunae.definition: (singular = lacuna) spaces in a bone that house an osteocyte

long bone.definition: cylinder-shaped bone that is longer than it is wide; functions as a lever

medullary cavity.definition: hollow region of the diaphysis; filled with yellow marrow

modeling.definition: process, during bone growth, by which bone is resorbed on one surface of a bone and deposited on another

nutrient foramen.definition: small opening in the middle of the external surface of the diaphysis, through which an artery enters the bone to provide nourishment

open reduction.definition: surgical exposure of a bone to reset a fracture

orthopedist.definition: doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating musculoskeletal disorders and injuries

osseous tissue.definition: bone tissue; a hard, dense connective tissue that forms the structural elements of the skeleton

ossification center.definition: cluster of osteoblasts found in the early stages of intramembranous ossification

osteoblast.definition: cell responsible for forming new bone

osteocyte.definition: primary cell in mature bone; responsible for maintaining the matrix

osteogenic cell.definition: undifferentiated cell with high mitotic activity; the only bone cells that divide; they differentiate and develop into osteoblasts

osteoid.definition: uncalcified bone matrix secreted by osteoblasts

osteon.definition: (also, Haversian system) basic structural unit of compact bone; made of concentric layers of calcified matrix

osteoporosis.definition: disease characterized by a decrease in bone mass; occurs when the rate of bone resorption exceeds the rate of bone formation, a common occurrence as the body ages

perforating canal.definition: (also, Volkmannâs canal) channel that branches off from the central canal and houses vessels and nerves that extend to the periosteum and endosteum

periosteum.definition: fibrous membrane covering the outer surface of bone and continuous with ligaments

primary ossification center.definition: region, deep in the periosteal collar, where bone development starts during endochondral ossification

projection.definition: bone markings where part of the surface sticks out above the rest of the surface, where tendons and ligaments attach

proliferative zone.definition: region of the epiphyseal plate that makes new chondrocytes to replace those that die at the diaphyseal end of the plate and contributes to longitudinal growth of the epiphyseal plate

red marrow.definition: connective tissue in the interior cavity of a bone where hematopoiesis takes place

remodeling.definition: process by which osteoclasts resorb old or damaged bone at the same time as and on the same surface where osteoblasts form new bone to replace that which is resorbed

reserve zone.definition: region of the epiphyseal plate that anchors the plate to the osseous tissue of the epiphysis

secondary ossification center.definition: region of bone development in the epiphyses

sesamoid bone.definition: small, round bone embedded in a tendon; protects the tendon from compressive forces

short bone.definition: cube-shaped bone that is approximately equal in length, width, and thickness; provides limited motion

skeletal system.definition: organ system composed of bones and cartilage that provides for movement, support, and protection

spongy bone.definition: (also, cancellous bone) trabeculated osseous tissue that supports shifts in weight distribution

trabeculae.definition: (singular = trabecula) spikes or sections of the lattice-like matrix in spongy bone

yellow marrow.definition: connective tissue in the interior cavity of a bone where fat is stored

zone of calcified matrix.definition: region of the epiphyseal plate closest to the diaphyseal end; functions to connect the epiphyseal plate to the diaphysis

zone of maturation and hypertrophy.definition: region of the epiphyseal plate where chondrocytes from the proliferative zone grow and mature and contribute to the longitudinal growth of the epiphyseal plate

alveolar process of the mandible.definition: upper border of mandibular body that contains the lower teeth

alveolar process of the maxilla.definition: curved, inferior margin of the maxilla that supports and anchors the upper teeth

angle of the mandible.definition: rounded corner located at outside margin of the body and ramus junction

angle of the rib.definition: portion of rib with greatest curvature; together, the rib angles form the most posterior extent of the thoracic cage

anterior (ventral) sacral foramen.definition: one of the series of paired openings located on the anterior (ventral) side of the sacrum

anterior arch.definition: anterior portion of the ring-like C1 (atlas) vertebra

anterior cranial fossa.definition: shallowest and most anterior cranial fossa of the cranial base that extends from the frontal bone to the lesser wing of the sphenoid bone

anterior longitudinal ligament.definition: ligament that runs the length of the vertebral column, uniting the anterior aspects of the vertebral bodies

anulus fibrosus.definition: tough, fibrous outer portion of an intervertebral disc, which is strongly anchored to the bodies of the adjacent vertebrae

appendicular skeleton.definition: all bones of the upper and lower limbs, plus the girdle bones that attach each limb to the axial skeleton

articular tubercle.definition: smooth ridge located on the inferior skull, immediately anterior to the mandibular fossa

axial skeleton.definition: central, vertical axis of the body, including the skull, vertebral column, and thoracic cage

brain case.definition: portion of the skull that contains and protects the brain, consisting of the eight bones that form the cranial base and rounded upper skull

calvaria.definition: (also, skullcap) rounded top of the skull

carotid canal.definition: zig-zag tunnel providing passage through the base of the skull for the internal carotid artery to the brain; begins anteromedial to the styloid process and terminates in the middle cranial cavity, near the posterior-lateral base of the sella turcica

cervical curve.definition: posteriorly concave curvature of the cervical vertebral column region; a secondary curve of the vertebral column

cervical vertebrae.definition: seven vertebrae numbered as C1âC7 that are located in the neck region of the vertebral column

clavicular notch.definition: paired notches located on the superior-lateral sides of the sternal manubrium, for articulation with the clavicle

coccyx.definition: small bone located at inferior end of the adult vertebral column that is formed by the fusion of four coccygeal vertebrae; also referred to as the âtailboneâ

condylar process of the mandible.definition: thickened upward projection from posterior margin of mandibular ramus

condyle.definition: oval-shaped process located at the top of the condylar process of the mandible

coronal suture.definition: joint that unites the frontal bone to the right and left parietal bones across the top of the skull

coronoid process of the mandible.definition: flattened upward projection from the anterior margin of the mandibular ramus

costal cartilage.definition: hyaline cartilage structure attached to the anterior end of each rib that provides for either direct or indirect attachment of most ribs to the sternum

costal facet.definition: site on the lateral sides of a thoracic vertebra for articulation with the head of a rib

costal groove.definition: shallow groove along the inferior margin of a rib that provides passage for blood vessels and a nerve

cranial cavity.definition: interior space of the skull that houses the brain

cribriform plate.definition: small, flattened areas with numerous small openings, located to either side of the midline in the floor of the anterior cranial fossa; formed by the ethmoid bone

crista galli.definition: small upward projection located at the midline in the floor of the anterior cranial fossa; formed by the ethmoid bone

dens.definition: bony projection (odontoid process) that extends upward from the body of the C2 (axis) vertebra

ear ossicles.definition: three small bones located in the middle ear cavity that serve to transmit sound vibrations to the inner ear

ethmoid air cell.definition: one of several small, air-filled spaces located within the lateral sides of the ethmoid bone, between the orbit and upper nasal cavity

ethmoid bone.definition: unpaired bone that forms the roof and upper, lateral walls of the nasal cavity, portions of the floor of the anterior cranial fossa and medial wall of orbit, and the upper portion of the nasal septum

external acoustic meatus.definition: ear canal opening located on the lateral side of the skull

external occipital protuberance.definition: small bump located at the midline on the posterior skull

facet.definition: small, flattened area on a bone for an articulation (joint) with another bone, or for muscle attachment

facial bones.definition: fourteen bones that support the facial structures and form the upper and lower jaws and the hard palate

false ribs.definition: vertebrochondral ribs 8â12 whose costal cartilage either attaches indirectly to the sternum via the costal cartilage of the next higher rib or does not attach to the sternum at all

floating ribs.definition: vertebral ribs 11â12 that do not attach to the sternum or to the costal cartilage of another rib

fontanelle.definition: expanded area of fibrous connective tissue that separates the brain case bones of the skull prior to birth and during the first year after birth

foramen lacerum.definition: irregular opening in the base of the skull, located inferior to the exit of carotid canal

foramen magnum.definition: large opening in the occipital bone of the skull through which the spinal cord emerges and the vertebral arteries enter the cranium

foramen ovale of the middle cranial foss.definition: oval-shaped opening in the floor of the middle cranial fossa

foramen rotundum.definition: round opening in the floor of the middle cranial fossa, located between the superior orbital fissure and foramen ovale

foramen spinosum.definition: small opening in the floor of the middle cranial fossa, located lateral to the foramen ovale

frontal bone.definition: unpaired bone that forms forehead, roof of orbit, and floor of anterior cranial fossa

frontal sinus.definition: air-filled space within the frontal bone; most anterior of the paranasal sinuses

glabella.definition: slight depression of frontal bone, located at the midline between the eyebrows

greater wings of sphenoid bone.definition: lateral projections of the sphenoid bone that form the anterior wall of the middle cranial fossa and an area of the lateral skull

hard palate.definition: bony structure that forms the roof of the mouth and floor of the nasal cavity, formed by the palatine process of the maxillary bones and the horizontal plate of the palatine bones

head of the rib.definition: posterior end of a rib that articulates with the bodies of thoracic vertebrae

horizontal plate.definition: medial extension from the palatine bone that forms the posterior quarter of the hard palate

hyoid bone.definition: small, U-shaped bone located in upper neck that does not contact any other bone

hypoglossal canal.definition: paired openings that pass anteriorly from the anterior-lateral margins of the foramen magnum deep to the occipital condyles

hypophyseal (pituitary) fossa.definition: shallow depression on top of the sella turcica that houses the pituitary (hypophyseal) gland

inferior articular process.definition: bony process that extends downward from the vertebral arch of a vertebra that articulates with the superior articular process of the next lower vertebra

inferior nasal concha.definition: one of the paired bones that project from the lateral walls of the nasal cavity to form the largest and most inferior of the nasal conchae

infraorbital foramen.definition: opening located on anterior skull, below the orbit

infratemporal fossa.definition: space on lateral side of skull, below the level of the zygomatic arch and deep (medial) to the ramus of the mandible

internal acoustic meatus.definition: opening into petrous ridge, located on the lateral wall of the posterior cranial fossa

intervertebral disc.definition: structure located between the bodies of adjacent vertebrae that strongly joins the vertebrae; provides padding, weight bearing ability, and enables vertebral column movements

intervertebral foramen.definition: opening located between adjacent vertebrae for exit of a spinal nerve

jugular (suprasternal) notch.definition: shallow notch located on superior surface of sternal manubrium

jugular foramen.definition: irregularly shaped opening located in the lateral floor of the posterior cranial cavity

kyphosis.definition: (also, humpback or hunchback) excessive posterior curvature of the thoracic vertebral column region

lacrimal bone.definition: paired bones that contribute to the anterior-medial wall of each orbit

lacrimal fossa.definition: shallow depression in the anterior-medial wall of the orbit, formed by the lacrimal bone that gives rise to the nasolacrimal canal

lambdoid suture.definition: inverted V-shaped joint that unites the occipital bone to the right and left parietal bones on the posterior skull

lamina.definition: portion of the vertebral arch on each vertebra that extends between the transverse and spinous process

lateral pterygoid plate.definition: paired, flattened bony projections of the sphenoid bone located on the inferior skull, lateral to the medial pterygoid plate

lateral sacral crest.definition: paired irregular ridges running down the lateral sides of the posterior sacrum that was formed by the fusion of the transverse processes from the five sacral vertebrae

lesser wings of the sphenoid bone.definition: lateral extensions of the sphenoid bone that form the bony lip separating the anterior and middle cranial fossae

ligamentum flavum.definition: series of short ligaments that unite the lamina of adjacent vertebrae

lingula.definition: small flap of bone located on the inner (medial) surface of mandibular ramus, next to the mandibular foramen

lordosis.definition: (also, swayback) excessive anterior curvature of the lumbar vertebral column region

lumbar curve.definition: posteriorly concave curvature of the lumbar vertebral column region; a secondary curve of the vertebral column

lumbar vertebrae.definition: five vertebrae numbered as L1âL5 that are located in lumbar region (lower back) of the vertebral column

mandible.definition: unpaired bone that forms the lower jaw bone; the only moveable bone of the skull

mandibular foramen.definition: opening located on the inner (medial) surface of the mandibular ramus

mandibular fossa.definition: oval depression located on the inferior surface of the skull

mandibular notch.definition: large U-shaped notch located between the condylar process and coronoid process of the mandible

manubrium.definition: expanded, superior portion of the sternum

mastoid process.definition: large bony prominence on the inferior, lateral skull, just behind the earlobe

maxillary bone.definition: (also, maxilla) paired bones that form the upper jaw and anterior portion of the hard palate

maxillary sinus.definition: air-filled space located with each maxillary bone; largest of the paranasal sinuses

medial pterygoid plate.definition: paired, flattened bony projections of the sphenoid bone located on the inferior skull medial to the lateral pterygoid plate; form the posterior portion of the nasal cavity lateral wall

median sacral crest.definition: irregular ridge running down the midline of the posterior sacrum that was formed from the fusion of the spinous processes of the five sacral vertebrae

mental foramen.definition: opening located on the anterior-lateral side of the mandibular body

mental protuberance.definition: inferior margin of anterior mandible that forms the chin

middle cranial fossa.definition: centrally located cranial fossa that extends from the lesser wings of the sphenoid bone to the petrous ridge

middle nasal concha.definition: nasal concha formed by the ethmoid bone that is located between the superior and inferior conchae

mylohyoid line.definition: bony ridge located along the inner (medial) surface of the mandibular body

nasal bone.definition: paired bones that form the base of the nose

nasal cavity.definition: opening through skull for passage of air

nasal conchae.definition: curved bony plates that project from the lateral walls of the nasal cavity; include the superior and middle nasal conchae, which are parts of the ethmoid bone, and the independent inferior nasal conchae bone

nasal septum.definition: flat, midline structure that divides the nasal cavity into halves, formed by the perpendicular plate of the ethmoid bone, vomer bone, and septal cartilage

nasolacrimal canal.definition: passage for drainage of tears that extends downward from the medial-anterior orbit to the nasal cavity, terminating behind the inferior nasal conchae

neck of the rib.definition: narrowed region of a rib, next to the rib head

notochord.definition: rod-like structure along dorsal side of the early embryo; largely disappears during later development but does contribute to formation of the intervertebral discs

nuchal ligament.definition: expanded portion of the supraspinous ligament within the posterior neck; interconnects the spinous processes of the cervical vertebrae and attaches to the base of the skull

nucleus pulposus.definition: gel-like central region of an intervertebral disc; provides for padding, weight-bearing, and movement between adjacent vertebrae

occipital bone.definition: unpaired bone that forms the posterior portions of the brain case and base of the skull

occipital condyle.definition: paired, oval-shaped bony knobs located on the inferior skull, to either side of the foramen magnum

optic canal.definition: opening spanning between middle cranial fossa and posterior orbit

orbit.definition: bony socket that contains the eyeball and associated muscles

palatine bone.definition: paired bones that form the posterior quarter of the hard palate and a small area in floor of the orbit

palatine process.definition: medial projection from the maxilla bone that forms the anterior three quarters of the hard palate

paranasal sinuses.definition: cavities within the skull that are connected to the conchae that serve to warm and humidify incoming air, produce mucus, and lighten the weight of the skull; consist of frontal, maxillary, sphenoidal, and ethmoidal sinuses

parietal bone.definition: paired bones that form the upper, lateral sides of the skull

pedicle.definition: portion of the vertebral arch that extends from the vertebral body to the transverse process

perpendicular plate of the ethmoid bone.definition: downward, midline extension of the ethmoid bone that forms the superior portion of the nasal septum

petrous ridge.definition: petrous portion of the temporal bone that forms a large, triangular ridge in the floor of the cranial cavity, separating the middle and posterior cranial fossae; houses the middle and inner ear structures

posterior (dorsal) sacral foramen.definition: one of the series of paired openings located on the posterior (dorsal) side of the sacrum

posterior arch.definition: posterior portion of the ring-like C1 (atlas) vertebra

posterior cranial fossa.definition: deepest and most posterior cranial fossa; extends from the petrous ridge to the occipital bone

posterior longitudinal ligament.definition: ligament that runs the length of the vertebral column, uniting the posterior sides of the vertebral bodies

primary curve.definition: anteriorly concave curvatures of the thoracic and sacrococcygeal regions that are retained from the original fetal curvature of the vertebral column

pterion.definition: H-shaped suture junction region that unites the frontal, parietal, temporal, and sphenoid bones on the lateral side of the skull

ribs.definition: thin, curved bones of the chest wall

sacral canal.definition: bony tunnel that runs through the sacrum

sacral foramina.definition: series of paired openings for nerve exit located on both the anterior (ventral) and posterior (dorsal) aspects of the sacrum

sacral hiatus.definition: inferior opening and termination of the sacral canal

sacral promontory.definition: anterior lip of the base (superior end) of the sacrum

sacrococcygeal curve.definition: anteriorly concave curvature formed by the sacrum and coccyx; a primary curve of the vertebral column

sacrum.definition: single bone located near the inferior end of the adult vertebral column that is formed by the fusion of five sacral vertebrae; forms the posterior portion of the pelvis

sagittal suture.definition: joint that unites the right and left parietal bones at the midline along the top of the skull

sclerotome.definition: medial portion of a somite consisting of mesenchyme tissue that will give rise to bone, cartilage, and fibrous connective tissues

scoliosis.definition: abnormal lateral curvature of the vertebral column

secondary curve.definition: posteriorly concave curvatures of the cervical and lumbar regions of the vertebral column that develop after the time of birth

sella turcica.definition: elevated area of sphenoid bone located at midline of the middle cranial fossa

septal cartilage.definition: flat cartilage structure that forms the anterior portion of the nasal septum

skull.definition: bony structure that forms the head, face, and jaws, and protects the brain; consists of 22 bones

somite.definition: one of the paired, repeating blocks of tissue located on either side of the notochord in the early embryo

sphenoid bone.definition: unpaired bone that forms the central base of skull

sphenoid sinus.definition: air-filled space located within the sphenoid bone; most posterior of the paranasal sinuses

spinous process.definition: unpaired bony process that extends posteriorly from the vertebral arch of a vertebra

squamous suture.definition: joint that unites the parietal bone to the squamous portion of the temporal bone on the lateral side of the skull

sternal angle.definition: junction line between manubrium and body of the sternum and the site for attachment of the second rib to the sternum

sternum.definition: flattened bone located at the center of the anterior chest

styloid process.definition: downward projecting, elongated bony process located on the inferior aspect of the skull

stylomastoid foramen.definition: opening located on inferior skull, between the styloid process and mastoid process

superior articular process.definition: bony process that extends upward from the vertebral arch of a vertebra that articulates with the inferior articular process of the next higher vertebra

superior articular process of the sacrum.definition: paired processes that extend upward from the sacrum to articulate (join) with the inferior articular processes from the L5 vertebra

superior nasal concha.definition: smallest and most superiorly located of the nasal conchae; formed by the ethmoid bone

superior nuchal line.definition: paired bony lines on the posterior skull that extend laterally from the external occipital protuberance

superior orbital fissure.definition: irregularly shaped opening between the middle cranial fossa and the posterior orbit

supraorbital foramen.definition: opening located on anterior skull, at the superior margin of the orbit

supraspinous ligament.definition: ligament that interconnects the spinous processes of the thoracic and lumbar vertebrae

suture.definition: junction line at which adjacent bones of the skull are united by fibrous connective tissue

temporal bone.definition: paired bones that form the lateral, inferior portions of the skull, with squamous, mastoid, and petrous portions

temporal fossa.definition: shallow space on the lateral side of the skull, above the level of the zygomatic arch

temporal process of the zygomatic bone.definition: short extension from the zygomatic bone that forms the anterior portion of the zygomatic arch

thoracic cage.definition: consists of 12 pairs of ribs and sternum

thoracic curve.definition: anteriorly concave curvature of the thoracic vertebral column region; a primary curve of the vertebral column

thoracic vertebrae.definition: twelve vertebrae numbered as T1âT12 that are located in the thoracic region (upper back) of the vertebral column

transverse foramen.definition: opening found only in the transverse processes of cervical vertebrae

transverse process.definition: paired bony processes that extends laterally from the vertebral arch of a vertebra

true ribs.definition: vertebrosternal ribs 1â7 that attach via their costal cartilage directly to the sternum

tubercle of the rib.definition: small bump on the posterior side of a rib for articulation with the transverse process of a thoracic vertebra

vertebra.definition: individual bone in the neck and back regions of the vertebral column

vertebral (spinal) canal.definition: bony passageway within the vertebral column for the spinal cord that is formed by the series of individual vertebral foramina

vertebral arch.definition: bony arch formed by the posterior portion of each vertebra that surrounds and protects the spinal cord

vertebral column.definition: entire sequence of bones that extend from the skull to the tailbone

vertebral foramen.definition: opening associated with each vertebra defined by the vertebral arch that provides passage for the spinal cord

vomer bone.definition: unpaired bone that forms the inferior and posterior portions of the nasal septum

xiphoid process.definition: small process that forms the inferior tip of the sternum

zygomatic arch.definition: elongated, free-standing arch on the lateral skull, formed anteriorly by the temporal process of the zygomatic bone and posteriorly by the zygomatic process of the temporal bone

zygomatic bone.definition: cheekbone; paired bones that contribute to the lateral orbit and anterior zygomatic arch

zygomatic process of the temporal bone.definition: extension from the temporal bone that forms the posterior portion of the zygomatic arch

acetabulum.definition: large, cup-shaped cavity located on the lateral side of the hip bone; formed by the junction of the ilium, pubis, and ischium portions of the hip bone

acromial end of the clavicle.definition: lateral end of the clavicle that articulates with the acromion of the scapula

acromioclavicular joint.definition: articulation between the acromion of the scapula and the acromial end of the clavicle

acromion.definition: flattened bony process that extends laterally from the scapular spine to form the bony tip of the shoulder

adductor tubercle.definition: small, bony bump located on the superior aspect of the medial epicondyle of the femur

anatomical neck.definition: line on the humerus located around the outside margin of the humeral head

ankle joint.definition: joint that separates the leg and foot portions of the lower limb; formed by the articulations between the talus bone of the foot inferiorly, and the distal end of the tibia, medial malleolus of the tibia, and lateral malleolus of the fibula superiorly

anterior border of the tibia.definition: narrow, anterior margin of the tibia that extends inferiorly from the tibial tuberosity

anterior inferior iliac spine.definition: small, bony projection located on the anterior margin of the ilium, below the anterior superior iliac spine

anterior sacroiliac ligament.definition: strong ligament between the sacrum and the ilium portions of the hip bone that supports the anterior side of the sacroiliac joint

anterior superior iliac spine.definition: rounded, anterior end of the iliac crest

apical ectodermal ridge.definition: enlarged ridge of ectoderm at the distal end of a limb bud that stimulates growth and elongation of the limb

arcuate line of the ilium.definition: smooth ridge located at the inferior margin of the iliac fossa; forms the lateral portion of the pelvic brim

arm.definition: region of the upper limb located between the shoulder and elbow joints; contains the humerus bone

auricular surface of the ilium.definition: roughened area located on the posterior, medial side of the ilium of the hip bone; articulates with the auricular surface of the sacrum to form the sacroiliac joint

base of the metatarsal bone.definition: expanded, proximal end of each metatarsal bone

bicipital groove.definition: intertubercular groove; narrow groove located between the greater and lesser tubercles of the humerus

calcaneus.definition: heel bone; posterior, inferior tarsal bone that forms the heel of the foot

capitate.definition: from the lateral side, the third of the four distal carpal bones; articulates with the scaphoid and lunate proximally, the trapezoid laterally, the hamate medially, and primarily with the third metacarpal distally

capitulum.definition: knob-like bony structure located anteriorly on the lateral, distal end of the humerus

carpal bone.definition: one of the eight small bones that form the wrist and base of the hand; these are grouped as a proximal row consisting of (from lateral to medial) the scaphoid, lunate, triquetrum, and pisiform bones, and a distal row containing (from lateral to medial) the trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, and hamate bones

carpal tunnel.definition: passageway between the anterior forearm and hand formed by the carpal bones and flexor retinaculum

carpometacarpal joint.definition: articulation between one of the carpal bones in the distal row and a metacarpal bone of the hand

clavicle.definition: collarbone; elongated bone that articulates with the manubrium of the sternum medially and the acromion of the scapula laterally

coracoclavicular ligament.definition: strong band of connective tissue that anchors the coracoid process of the scapula to the lateral clavicle; provides important indirect support for the acromioclavicular joint

coracoid process.definition: short, hook-like process that projects anteriorly and laterally from the superior margin of the scapula

coronoid fossa.definition: depression on the anterior surface of the humerus above the trochlea; this space receives the coronoid process of the ulna when the elbow is maximally flexed

coronoid process of the ulna.definition: projecting bony lip located on the anterior, proximal ulna; forms the inferior margin of the trochlear notch

costoclavicular ligament.definition: band of connective tissue that unites the medial clavicle with the first rib

cuboid.definition: tarsal bone that articulates posteriorly with the calcaneus bone, medially with the lateral cuneiform bone, and anteriorly with the fourth and fifth metatarsal bones

deltoid tuberosity.definition: roughened, V-shaped region located laterally on the mid-shaft of the humerus

distal radioulnar joint.definition: articulation between the head of the ulna and the ulnar notch of the radius

distal tibiofibular joint.definition: articulation between the distal fibula and the fibular notch of the tibia

elbow joint.definition: joint located between the upper arm and forearm regions of the upper limb; formed by the articulations between the trochlea of the humerus and the trochlear notch of the ulna, and the capitulum of the humerus and the head of the radius

femur.definition: thigh bone; the single bone of the thigh

fibula.definition: thin, non-weight-bearing bone found on the lateral side of the leg

fibular notch.definition: wide groove on the lateral side of the distal tibia for articulation with the fibula at the distal tibiofibular joint

flexor retinaculum.definition: strong band of connective tissue at the anterior wrist that spans the top of the U-shaped grouping of the carpal bones to form the roof of the carpal tunnel

foot.definition: portion of the lower limb located distal to the ankle joint

forearm.definition: region of the upper limb located between the elbow and wrist joints; contains the radius and ulna bones

fossa.definition: (plural = fossae) shallow depression on the surface of a bone

fovea capitis.definition: minor indentation on the head of the femur that serves as the site of attachment for the ligament to the head of the femur

glenohumeral joint.definition: shoulder joint; formed by the articulation between the glenoid cavity of the scapula and the head of the humerus

glenoid cavity.definition: (also, glenoid fossa) shallow depression located on the lateral scapula, between the superior and lateral borders

gluteal tuberosity.definition: roughened area on the posterior side of the proximal femur, extending inferiorly from the base of the greater trochanter

greater pelvis.definition: (also, greater pelvic cavity or false pelvis) broad space above the pelvic brim defined laterally by the fan-like portion of the upper ilium

greater sciatic foramen.definition: pelvic opening formed by the greater sciatic notch of the hip bone, the sacrum, and the sacrospinous ligament

greater sciatic notch.definition: large, U-shaped indentation located on the posterior margin of the ilium, superior to the ischial spine

greater trochanter.definition: large, bony expansion of the femur that projects superiorly from the base of the femoral neck

greater tubercle.definition: enlarged prominence located on the lateral side of the proximal humerus

hallux.definition: big toe; digit 1 of the foot

hamate.definition: from the lateral side, the fourth of the four distal carpal bones; articulates with the lunate and triquetrum proximally, the fourth and fifth metacarpals distally, and the capitate laterally

hand.definition: region of the upper limb distal to the wrist joint

head of the femur.definition: rounded, proximal end of the femur that articulates with the acetabulum of the hip bone to form the hip joint

head of the fibula.definition: small, knob-like, proximal end of the fibula; articulates with the inferior aspect of the lateral condyle of the tibia

head of the humerus.definition: smooth, rounded region on the medial side of the proximal humerus; articulates with the glenoid fossa of the scapula to form the glenohumeral (shoulder) joint

head of the metatarsal bone.definition: expanded, distal end of each metatarsal bone

head of the radius.definition: disc-shaped structure that forms the proximal end of the radius; articulates with the capitulum of the humerus as part of the elbow joint, and with the radial notch of the ulna as part of the proximal radioulnar joint

head of the ulna.definition: small, rounded distal end of the ulna; articulates with the ulnar notch of the distal radius, forming the distal radioulnar joint

hip bone.definition: coxal bone; single bone that forms the pelvic girdle; consists of three areas, the ilium, ischium, and pubis

hip joint.definition: joint located at the proximal end of the lower limb; formed by the articulation between the acetabulum of the hip bone and the head of the femur

hook of the hamate bone.definition: bony extension located on the anterior side of the hamate carpal bone

humerus.definition: single bone of the upper arm

iliac crest.definition: curved, superior margin of the ilium

iliac fossa.definition: shallow depression found on the anterior and medial surfaces of the upper ilium

ilium.definition: superior portion of the hip bone

inferior angle of the scapula.definition: inferior corner of the scapula located where the medial and lateral borders meet

inferior pubic ramus.definition: narrow segment of bone that passes inferiorly and laterally from the pubic body; joins with the ischial ramus to form the ischiopubic ramus

infraglenoid tubercle.definition: small bump or roughened area located on the lateral border of the scapula, near the inferior margin of the glenoid cavity

infraspinous fossa.definition: broad depression located on the posterior scapula, inferior to the spine

intercondylar eminence.definition: irregular elevation on the superior end of the tibia, between the articulating surfaces of the medial and lateral condyles

intercondylar fossa.definition: deep depression on the posterior side of the distal femur that separates the medial and lateral condyles

intermediate cuneiform.definition: middle of the three cuneiform tarsal bones; articulates posteriorly with the navicular bone, medially with the medial cuneiform bone, laterally with the lateral cuneiform bone, and anteriorly with the second metatarsal bone

interosseous border of the fibula.definition: small ridge running down the medial side of the fibular shaft; for attachment of the interosseous membrane between the fibula and tibia

interosseous border of the radius.definition: narrow ridge located on the medial side of the radial shaft; for attachment of the interosseous membrane between the ulna and radius bones

interosseous border of the tibia.definition: small ridge running down the lateral side of the tibial shaft; for attachment of the interosseous membrane between the tibia and fibula

interosseous border of the ulna.definition: narrow ridge located on the lateral side of the ulnar shaft; for attachment of the interosseous membrane between the ulna and radius

interosseous membrane of the forearm.definition: sheet of dense connective tissue that unites the radius and ulna bones

interosseous membrane of the leg.definition: sheet of dense connective tissue that unites the shafts of the tibia and fibula bones

interphalangeal joint.definition: articulation between adjacent phalanx bones of the hand or foot digits

intertrochanteric crest.definition: short, prominent ridge running between the greater and lesser trochanters on the posterior side of the proximal femur

intertrochanteric line.definition: small ridge running between the greater and lesser trochanters on the anterior side of the proximal femur

intertubercular groove (sulcus).definition: bicipital groove; narrow groove located between the greater and lesser tubercles of the humerus

ischial ramus.definition: bony extension projecting anteriorly and superiorly from the ischial tuberosity; joins with the inferior pubic ramus to form the ischiopubic ramus

ischial spine.definition: pointed, bony projection from the posterior margin of the ischium that separates the greater sciatic notch and lesser sciatic notch

ischial tuberosity.definition: large, roughened protuberance that forms the posteroinferior portion of the hip bone; weight-bearing region of the pelvis when sitting

ischiopubic ramus.definition: narrow extension of bone that connects the ischial tuberosity to the pubic body; formed by the junction of the ischial ramus and inferior pubic ramus

ischium.definition: posteroinferior portion of the hip bone

knee joint.definition: joint that separates the thigh and leg portions of the lower limb; formed by the articulations between the medial and lateral condyles of the femur, and the medial and lateral condyles of the tibia

lateral border of the scapula.definition: diagonally oriented lateral margin of the scapula

lateral condyle of the femur.definition: smooth, articulating surface that forms the distal and posterior sides of the lateral expansion of the distal femur

lateral condyle of the tibia.definition: lateral, expanded region of the proximal tibia that includes the smooth surface that articulates with the lateral condyle of the femur as part of the knee joint

lateral cuneiform.definition: most lateral of the three cuneiform tarsal bones; articulates posteriorly with the navicular bone, medially with the intermediate cuneiform bone, laterally with the cuboid bone, and anteriorly with the third metatarsal bone

lateral epicondyle of the femur.definition: roughened area of the femur located on the lateral side of the lateral condyle

lateral epicondyle of the humerus.definition: small projection located on the lateral side of the distal humerus

lateral malleolus.definition: expanded distal end of the fibula

lateral supracondylar ridge.definition: narrow, bony ridge located along the lateral side of the distal humerus, superior to the lateral epicondyle

leg.definition: portion of the lower limb located between the knee and ankle joints

lesser pelvis.definition: (also, lesser pelvic cavity or true pelvis) narrow space located within the pelvis, defined superiorly by the pelvic brim (pelvic inlet) and inferiorly by the pelvic outlet

lesser sciatic foramen.definition: pelvic opening formed by the lesser sciatic notch of the hip bone, the sacrospinous ligament, and the sacrotuberous ligament

lesser sciatic notch.definition: shallow indentation along the posterior margin of the ischium, inferior to the ischial spine

lesser trochanter.definition: small, bony projection on the medial side of the proximal femur, at the base of the femoral neck

lesser tubercle.definition: small, bony prominence located on anterior side of the proximal humerus

ligament of the head of the femur.definition: ligament that spans the acetabulum of the hip bone and the fovea capitis of the femoral head

limb bud.definition: small elevation that appears on the lateral side of the embryo during the fourth or fifth week of development, which gives rise to an upper or lower limb

linea aspera.definition: longitudinally running bony ridge located in the middle third of the posterior femur

lunate.definition: from the lateral side, the second of the four proximal carpal bones; articulates with the radius proximally, the capitate and hamate distally, the scaphoid laterally, and the triquetrum medially

medial border of the scapula.definition: elongated, medial margin of the scapula

medial condyle of the femur.definition: smooth, articulating surface that forms the distal and posterior sides of the medial expansion of the distal femur

medial condyle of the tibia.definition: medial, expanded region of the proximal tibia that includes the smooth surface that articulates with the medial condyle of the femur as part of the knee joint

medial cuneiform.definition: most medial of the three cuneiform tarsal bones; articulates posteriorly with the navicular bone, laterally with the intermediate cuneiform bone, and anteriorly with the first and second metatarsal bones

medial epicondyle of the femur.definition: roughened area of the distal femur located on the medial side of the medial condyle

medial epicondyle of the humerus.definition: enlarged projection located on the medial side of the distal humerus

medial malleolus.definition: bony expansion located on the medial side of the distal tibia

metacarpal bone.definition: one of the five long bones that form the palm of the hand; numbered 1â5, starting on the lateral (thumb) side of the hand

metacarpophalangeal joint.definition: articulation between the distal end of a metacarpal bone of the hand and a proximal phalanx bone of the thumb or a finger

metatarsal bone.definition: one of the five elongated bones that forms the anterior half of the foot; numbered 1â5, starting on the medial side of the foot

metatarsophalangeal joint.definition: articulation between a metatarsal bone of the foot and the proximal phalanx bone of a toe

midcarpal joint.definition: articulation between the proximal and distal rows of the carpal bones; contributes to movements of the hand at the wrist

navicular.definition: tarsal bone that articulates posteriorly with the talus bone, laterally with the cuboid bone, and anteriorly with the medial, intermediate, and lateral cuneiform bones

neck of the femur.definition: narrowed region located inferior to the head of the femur

neck of the radius.definition: narrowed region immediately distal to the head of the radius

obturator foramen.definition: large opening located in the anterior hip bone, between the pubis and ischium regions

olecranon fossa.definition: large depression located on the posterior side of the distal humerus; this space receives the olecranon process of the ulna when the elbow is fully extended

olecranon process.definition: expanded posterior and superior portions of the proximal ulna; forms the bony tip of the elbow

patella.definition: kneecap; the largest sesamoid bone of the body; articulates with the distal femur

patellar surface.definition: smooth groove located on the anterior side of the distal femur, between the medial and lateral condyles; site of articulation for the patella

pectineal line.definition: narrow ridge located on the superior surface of the superior pubic ramus

pectoral girdle.definition: shoulder girdle; the set of bones, consisting of the scapula and clavicle, which attaches each upper limb to the axial skeleton

pelvic brim.definition: pelvic inlet; the dividing line between the greater and lesser pelvic regions; formed by the superior margin of the pubic symphysis, the pectineal lines of each pubis, the arcuate lines of each ilium, and the sacral promontory

pelvic girdle.definition: hip girdle; consists of a single hip bone, which attaches a lower limb to the sacrum of the axial skeleton

pelvic outlet.definition: inferior opening of the lesser pelvis; formed by the inferior margin of the pubic symphysis, right and left ischiopubic rami and sacrotuberous ligaments, and the tip of the coccyx

pelvis.definition: ring of bone consisting of the right and left hip bones, the sacrum, and the coccyx

phalanx bone of the foot.definition: (plural = phalanges) one of the 14 bones that form the toes; these include the proximal and distal phalanges of the big toe, and the proximal, middle, and distal phalanx bones of toes two through five

phalanx bone of the hand.definition: (plural = phalanges) one of the 14 bones that form the thumb and fingers; these include the proximal and distal phalanges of the thumb, and the proximal, middle, and distal phalanx bones of the fingers two through five

pisiform.definition: from the lateral side, the fourth of the four proximal carpal bones; articulates with the anterior surface of the triquetrum

posterior inferior iliac spine.definition: small, bony projection located at the inferior margin of the auricular surface on the posterior ilium

posterior sacroiliac ligament.definition: strong ligament spanning the sacrum and ilium of the hip bone that supports the posterior side of the sacroiliac joint

posterior superior iliac spine.definition: rounded, posterior end of the iliac crest

proximal radioulnar joint.definition: articulation formed by the radial notch of the ulna and the head of the radius

proximal tibiofibular joint.definition: articulation between the head of the fibula and the inferior aspect of the lateral condyle of the tibia

pubic arch.definition: bony structure formed by the pubic symphysis, and the bodies and inferior pubic rami of the right and left pubic bones

pubic body.definition: enlarged, medial portion of the pubis region of the hip bone

pubic symphysis.definition: joint formed by the articulation between the pubic bodies of the right and left hip bones

pubic tubercle.definition: small bump located on the superior aspect of the pubic body

pubis.definition: anterior portion of the hip bone

radial fossa.definition: small depression located on the anterior humerus above the capitulum; this space receives the head of the radius when the elbow is maximally flexed

radial notch of the ulna.definition: small, smooth area on the lateral side of the proximal ulna; articulates with the head of the radius as part of the proximal radioulnar joint

radial tuberosity.definition: oval-shaped, roughened protuberance located on the medial side of the proximal radius

radiocarpal joint.definition: wrist joint, located between the forearm and hand regions of the upper limb; articulation formed proximally by the distal end of the radius and the fibrocartilaginous pad that unites the distal radius and ulna bone, and distally by the scaphoid, lunate, and triquetrum carpal bones

radius.definition: bone located on the lateral side of the forearm

sacroiliac joint.definition: joint formed by the articulation between the auricular surfaces of the sacrum and ilium

sacrospinous ligament.definition: ligament that spans the sacrum to the ischial spine of the hip bone

sacrotuberous ligament.definition: ligament that spans the sacrum to the ischial tuberosity of the hip bone

scaphoid.definition: from the lateral side, the first of the four proximal carpal bones; articulates with the radius proximally, the trapezoid, trapezium, and capitate distally, and the lunate medially

scapula.definition: shoulder blade bone located on the posterior side of the shoulder

shaft of the femur.definition: cylindrically shaped region that forms the central portion of the femur

shaft of the fibula.definition: elongated, slender portion located between the expanded ends of the fibula

shaft of the humerus.definition: narrow, elongated, central region of the humerus

shaft of the radius.definition: narrow, elongated, central region of the radius

shaft of the tibia.definition: triangular-shaped, central portion of the tibia

shaft of the ulna.definition: narrow, elongated, central region of the ulna

soleal line.definition: small, diagonally running ridge located on the posterior side of the proximal tibia

spine of the scapula.definition: prominent ridge passing mediolaterally across the upper portion of the posterior scapular surface

sternal end of the clavicle.definition: medial end of the clavicle that articulates with the manubrium of the sternum

sternoclavicular joint.definition: articulation between the manubrium of the sternum and the sternal end of the clavicle; forms the only bony attachment between the pectoral girdle of the upper limb and the axial skeleton

styloid process of the radius.definition: pointed projection located on the lateral end of the distal radius

styloid process of the ulna.definition: short, bony projection located on the medial end of the distal ulna

subpubic angle.definition: inverted V-shape formed by the convergence of the right and left ischiopubic rami; this angle is greater than 80 degrees in females and less than 70 degrees in males

subscapular fossa.definition: broad depression located on the anterior (deep) surface of the scapula

superior angle of the scapula.definition: corner of the scapula between the superior and medial borders of the scapula

superior pubic ramus.definition: narrow segment of bone that passes laterally from the pubic body to join the ilium

supraglenoid tubercle.definition: small bump located at the superior margin of the glenoid cavity

suprascapular notch.definition: small notch located along the superior border of the scapula, medial to the coracoid process

supraspinous fossa.definition: narrow depression located on the posterior scapula, superior to the spine

surgical neck.definition: region of the humerus where the expanded, proximal end joins with the narrower shaft

sustentaculum tali.definition: bony ledge extending from the medial side of the calcaneus bone

talus.definition: tarsal bone that articulates superiorly with the tibia and fibula at the ankle joint; also articulates inferiorly with the calcaneus bone and anteriorly with the navicular bone

tarsal bone.definition: one of the seven bones that make up the posterior foot; includes the calcaneus, talus, navicular, cuboid, medial cuneiform, intermediate cuneiform, and lateral cuneiform bones

thigh.definition: portion of the lower limb located between the hip and knee joints

tibia.definition: shin bone; the large, weight-bearing bone located on the medial side of the leg

tibial tuberosity.definition: elevated area on the anterior surface of the proximal tibia

trapezium.definition: from the lateral side, the first of the four distal carpal bones; articulates with the scaphoid proximally, the first and second metacarpals distally, and the trapezoid medially

trapezoid.definition: from the lateral side, the second of the four distal carpal bones; articulates with the scaphoid proximally, the second metacarpal distally, the trapezium laterally, and the capitate medially

triquetrum.definition: from the lateral side, the third of the four proximal carpal bones; articulates with the lunate laterally, the hamate distally, and has a facet for the pisiform

trochlea.definition: pulley-shaped region located medially at the distal end of the humerus; articulates at the elbow with the trochlear notch of the ulna

trochlear notch.definition: large, C-shaped depression located on the anterior side of the proximal ulna; articulates at the elbow with the trochlea of the humerus

ulna.definition: bone located on the medial side of the forearm

ulnar notch of the radius.definition: shallow, smooth area located on the medial side of the distal radius; articulates with the head of the ulna at the distal radioulnar joint

ulnar tuberosity.definition: roughened area located on the anterior, proximal ulna inferior to the coronoid process

abduction.definition: movement in the coronal plane that moves a limb laterally away from the body; spreading of the fingers

acetabular labrum.definition: lip of fibrocartilage that surrounds outer margin of the acetabulum on the hip bone

adduction.definition: movement in the coronal plane that moves a limb medially toward or across the midline of the body; bringing fingers together

annular ligament.definition: intrinsic ligament of the elbow articular capsule that surrounds and supports the head of the radius at the proximal radioulnar joint

anterior cruciate ligament.definition: intracapsular ligament of the knee; extends from anterior, superior surface of the tibia to the inner aspect of the lateral condyle of the femur; resists hyperextension of knee

anterior talofibular ligament.definition: intrinsic ligament located on the lateral side of the ankle joint, between talus bone and lateral malleolus of fibula; supports talus at the talocrural joint and resists excess inversion of the foot

articular capsule.definition: connective tissue structure that encloses the joint cavity of a synovial joint

articular cartilage.definition: thin layer of hyaline cartilage that covers the articulating surfaces of bones at a synovial joint

articular disc.definition: meniscus; a fibrocartilage structure found between the bones of some synovial joints; provides padding or smooths movements between the bones; strongly unites the bones together

atlanto-occipital joint.definition: articulation between the occipital condyles of the skull and the superior articular processes of the atlas (C1 vertebra)

atlantoaxial joint.definition: series of three articulations between the atlas (C1) vertebra and the axis (C2) vertebra, consisting of the joints between the inferior articular processes of C1 and the superior articular processes of C2, and the articulation between the dens of C2 and the anterior arch of C1

ball-and-socket joint.definition: synovial joint formed between the spherical end of one bone (the ball) that fits into the depression of a second bone (the socket); found at the hip and shoulder joints; functionally classified as a multiaxial joint

biaxial joint.definition: type of diarthrosis; a joint that allows for movements within two planes (two axes)

bursa.definition: connective tissue sac containing lubricating fluid that prevents friction between adjacent structures, such as skin and bone, tendons and bone, or between muscles

calcaneofibular ligament.definition: intrinsic ligament located on the lateral side of the ankle joint, between the calcaneus bone and lateral malleolus of the fibula; supports the talus bone at the ankle joint and resists excess inversion of the foot

cartilaginous joint.definition: joint at which the bones are united by hyaline cartilage (synchondrosis) or fibrocartilage (symphysis)

circumduction.definition: circular motion of the arm, thigh, hand, thumb, or finger that is produced by the sequential combination of flexion, abduction, extension, and adduction

condyloid joint.definition: synovial joint in which the shallow depression at the end of one bone receives a rounded end from a second bone or a rounded structure formed by two bones; found at the metacarpophalangeal joints of the fingers or the radiocarpal joint of the wrist; functionally classified as a biaxial joint

coracohumeral ligament.definition: intrinsic ligament of the shoulder joint; runs from the coracoid process of the scapula to the anterior humerus

deltoid ligament.definition: broad intrinsic ligament located on the medial side of the ankle joint; supports the talus at the talocrural joint and resists excess eversion of the foot

depression.definition: downward (inferior) motion of the scapula or mandible

dorsiflexion.definition: movement at the ankle that brings the top of the foot toward the anterior leg

elevation.definition: upward (superior) motion of the scapula or mandible

eversion.definition: foot movement involving the intertarsal joints of the foot in which the bottom of the foot is turned laterally, away from the midline

extension.definition: movement in the sagittal plane that increases the angle of a joint (straightens the joint); motion involving posterior bending of the vertebral column or returning to the upright position from a flexed position

extrinsic ligament.definition: ligament located outside of the articular capsule of a synovial joint

femoropatellar joint.definition: portion of the knee joint consisting of the articulation between the distal femur and the patella

fibrous joint.definition: joint where the articulating areas of the adjacent bones are connected by fibrous connective tissue

fibular collateral ligament.definition: extrinsic ligament of the knee joint that spans from the lateral epicondyle of the femur to the head of the fibula; resists hyperextension and rotation of the extended knee

flexion.definition: movement in the sagittal plane that decreases the angle of a joint (bends the joint); motion involving anterior bending of the vertebral column

fontanelles.definition: expanded areas of fibrous connective tissue that separate the braincase bones of the skull prior to birth and during the first year after birth

glenohumeral joint.definition: shoulder joint; articulation between the glenoid cavity of the scapula and head of the humerus; multiaxial ball-and-socket joint that allows for flexion/extension, abduction/adduction, circumduction, and medial/lateral rotation of the humerus

glenohumeral ligament.definition: one of the three intrinsic ligaments of the shoulder joint that strengthen the anterior articular capsule

glenoid labrum.definition: lip of fibrocartilage located around the outside margin of the glenoid cavity of the scapula

gomphosis.definition: type of fibrous joint in which the root of a tooth is anchored into its bony jaw socket by strong periodontal ligaments

hinge joint.definition: synovial joint at which the convex surface of one bone articulates with the concave surface of a second bone; includes the elbow, knee, ankle, and interphalangeal joints; functionally classified as a uniaxial joint

humeroradial joint.definition: articulation between the capitulum of the humerus and head of the radius

humeroulnar joint.definition: articulation between the trochlea of humerus and the trochlear notch of the ulna; uniaxial hinge joint that allows for flexion/extension of the forearm

hyperextension.definition: excessive extension of joint, beyond the normal range of movement

hyperflexion.definition: excessive flexion of joint, beyond the normal range of movement

iliofemoral ligament.definition: intrinsic ligament spanning from the ilium of the hip bone to the femur, on the superior-anterior aspect of the hip joint

inferior rotation.definition: movement of the scapula during upper limb adduction in which the glenoid cavity of the scapula moves in a downward direction as the medial end of the scapular spine moves in an upward direction

interosseous membrane.definition: wide sheet of fibrous connective tissue that fills the gap between two parallel bones, forming a syndesmosis; found between the radius and ulna of the forearm and between the tibia and fibula of the leg

intracapsular ligament.definition: ligament that is located within the articular capsule of a synovial joint

intrinsic ligament.definition: ligament that is fused to or incorporated into the wall of the articular capsule of a synovial joint

inversion.definition: foot movement involving the intertarsal joints of the foot in which the bottom of the foot is turned toward the midline

ischiofemoral ligament.definition: intrinsic ligament spanning from the ischium of the hip bone to the femur, on the posterior aspect of the hip joint

joint.definition: site at which two or more bones or bone and cartilage come together (articulate)

joint cavity.definition: space enclosed by the articular capsule of a synovial joint that is filled with synovial fluid and contains the articulating surfaces of the adjacent bones

joint interzone.definition: site within a growing embryonic limb bud that will become a synovial joint

lateral (external) rotation.definition: movement of the arm at the shoulder joint or the thigh at the hip joint that moves the anterior surface of the limb away from the midline of the body

lateral excursion.definition: side-to-side movement of the mandible away from the midline, toward either the right or left side

lateral flexion.definition: bending of the neck or body toward the right or left side

lateral meniscus.definition: C-shaped fibrocartilage articular disc located at the knee, between the lateral condyle of the femur and the lateral condyle of the tibia

lateral tibiofemoral joint.definition: portion of the knee consisting of the articulation between the lateral condyle of the tibia and the lateral condyle of the femur; allows for flexion/extension at the knee

ligament.definition: strong band of dense connective tissue spanning between bones

ligament of the head of the femur.definition: intracapsular ligament that runs from the acetabulum of the hip bone to the head of the femur

medial (internal) rotation.definition: movement of the arm at the shoulder joint or the thigh at the hip joint that brings the anterior surface of the limb toward the midline of the body

medial excursion.definition: side-to-side movement that returns the mandible to the midline

medial meniscus.definition: C-shaped fibrocartilage articular disc located at the knee, between the medial condyle of the femur and medial condyle of the tibia

medial tibiofemoral joint.definition: portion of the knee consisting of the articulation between the medial condyle of the tibia and the medial condyle of the femur; allows for flexion/extension at the knee

multiaxial joint.definition: type of diarthrosis; a joint that allows for movements within three planes (three axes)

opposition.definition: thumb movement that brings the tip of the thumb in contact with the tip of a finger

patellar ligament.definition: ligament spanning from the patella to the anterior tibia; serves as the final attachment for the quadriceps femoris muscle

periodontal ligament.definition: band of dense connective tissue that anchors the root of a tooth into the bony jaw socket

pivot joint.definition: synovial joint at which the rounded portion of a bone rotates within a ring formed by a ligament and an articulating bone; functionally classified as uniaxial joint

plane joint.definition: synovial joint formed between the flattened articulating surfaces of adjacent bones; functionally classified as a multiaxial joint

plantar flexion.definition: foot movement at the ankle in which the heel is lifted off of the ground

posterior cruciate ligament.definition: intracapsular ligament of the knee; extends from the posterior, superior surface of the tibia to the inner aspect of the medial condyle of the femur; prevents anterior displacement of the femur when the knee is flexed and weight bearing

posterior talofibular ligament.definition: intrinsic ligament located on the lateral side of the ankle joint, between the talus bone and lateral malleolus of the fibula; supports the talus at the talocrural joint and resists excess inversion of the foot

pronated position.definition: forearm position in which the palm faces backward

pronation.definition: forearm motion that moves the palm of the hand from the palm forward to the palm backward position

protraction.definition: anterior motion of the scapula or mandible

proximal radioulnar joint.definition: articulation between head of radius and radial notch of ulna; uniaxial pivot joint that allows for rotation of radius during pronation/supination of forearm

pubofemoral ligament.definition: intrinsic ligament spanning from the pubis of the hip bone to the femur, on the anterior-inferior aspect of the hip joint

radial collateral ligament.definition: intrinsic ligament on the lateral side of the elbow joint; runs from the lateral epicondyle of humerus to merge with the annular ligament

reposition.definition: movement of the thumb from opposition back to the anatomical position (next to index finger)

retraction.definition: posterior motion of the scapula or mandible

rotation.definition: movement of a bone around a central axis (atlantoaxial joint) or around its long axis (proximal radioulnar joint; shoulder or hip joint); twisting of the vertebral column resulting from the summation of small motions between adjacent vertebrae

rotator cuff.definition: strong connective tissue structure formed by the fusion of four rotator cuff muscle tendons to the articular capsule of the shoulder joint; surrounds and supports superior, anterior, lateral, and posterior sides of the humeral head

saddle joint.definition: synovial joint in which the articulating ends of both bones are convex and concave in shape, such as at the first carpometacarpal joint at the base of the thumb; functionally classified as a biaxial joint

subacromial bursa.definition: bursa that protects the supraspinatus muscle tendon and superior end of the humerus from rubbing against the acromion of the scapula

subcutaneous bursa.definition: bursa that prevents friction between skin and an underlying bone

submuscular bursa.definition: bursa that prevents friction between bone and a muscle or between adjacent muscles

subscapular bursa.definition: bursa that prevents rubbing of the subscapularis muscle tendon against the scapula

subtalar joint.definition: articulation between the talus and calcaneus bones of the foot; allows motions that contribute to inversion/eversion of the foot

subtendinous bursa.definition: bursa that prevents friction between bone and a muscle tendon

superior rotation.definition: movement of the scapula during upper limb abduction in which the glenoid cavity of the scapula moves in an upward direction as the medial end of the scapular spine moves in a downward direction

supinated position.definition: forearm position in which the palm faces anteriorly (anatomical position)

supination.definition: forearm motion that moves the palm of the hand from the palm backward to the palm forward position

suture.definition: fibrous joint that connects the bones of the skull (except the mandible); an immobile joint (synarthrosis)

symphysis.definition: type of cartilaginous joint where the bones are joined by fibrocartilage

synchondrosis.definition: type of cartilaginous joint where the bones are joined by hyaline cartilage

syndesmosis.definition: type of fibrous joint in which two separated, parallel bones are connected by an interosseous membrane

synostosis.definition: site at which adjacent bones or bony components have fused together

synovial fluid.definition: thick, lubricating fluid that fills the interior of a synovial joint

synovial joint.definition: joint at which the articulating surfaces of the bones are located within a joint cavity formed by an articular capsule

synovial membrane.definition: thin layer that lines the inner surface of the joint cavity at a synovial joint; produces the synovial fluid

talocrural joint.definition: ankle joint; articulation between the talus bone of the foot and medial malleolus of the tibia, distal tibia, and lateral malleolus of the fibula; a uniaxial hinge joint that allows only for dorsiflexion and plantar flexion of the foot

temporomandibular joint (TMJ).definition: articulation between the condyle of the mandible and the mandibular fossa and articular tubercle of the temporal bone of the skull; allows for depression/elevation (opening/closing of mouth), protraction/retraction, and side-to-side motions of the mandible

tendon.definition: dense connective tissue structure that anchors a muscle to bone

tendon sheath.definition: connective tissue that surrounds a tendon at places where the tendon crosses a joint; contains a lubricating fluid to prevent friction and allow smooth movements of the tendon

tibial collateral ligament.definition: extrinsic ligament of knee joint that spans from the medial epicondyle of the femur to the medial tibia; resists hyperextension and rotation of extended knee
