metabolism.definition: sum of all catabolic and anabolic reactions that take place in the body

minerals.definition: inorganic compounds required by the body to ensure proper function of the body

monoglyceride molecules.definition: lipid consisting of a single fatty acid chain attached to a glycerol backbone

oxidation-reduction reaction.definition: (also, redox reaction) pair of reactions in which an electron is passed from one molecule to another, oxidizing one and reducing the other

oxidative phosphorylation.definition: process that converts high-energy NADH and FADH2into ATP

pancreatic lipases.definition: enzymes released from the pancreas that digest lipids in the diet

pepsin.definition: enzyme that begins to break down proteins in the stomach

polysaccharides.definition: complex carbohydrates made up of many monosaccharides

postabsorptive state.definition: also called the fasting state; the metabolic state occurring after digestion when food is no longer the bodyâs source of energy and it must rely on stored glycogen

proteolysis.definition: process of breaking proteins into smaller peptides

pyruvate.definition: three-carbon end product of glycolysis and starting material that is converted into acetyl CoA that enters the Krebs cycle

radiation.definition: transfer of heat via infrared waves

salivary amylase.definition: digestive enzyme that is found in the saliva and begins the digestion of carbohydrates in the mouth

secretin.definition: hormone released in the small intestine to aid in digestion

sodium bicarbonate.definition: anion released into the small intestine to neutralize the pH of the food from the stomach

terminal electron acceptor.definition: oxygen, the recipient of the free hydrogen at the end of the electron transport chain

thermoneutral.definition: external temperature at which the body does not expend any energy for thermoregulation, about 84 Â°F

thermoregulation.definition: process of regulating the temperature of the body

transamination.definition: transfer of an amine group from one molecule to another as a way to turn nitrogen waste into ammonia so that it can enter the urea cycle

tricarboxylic acid cycle (TCA).definition: also called the Krebs cycle or the citric acid cycle; converts pyruvate into CO2and high-energy FADH2, NADH, and ATP molecules

triglycerides.definition: lipids, or fats, consisting of three fatty acid chains attached to a glycerol backbone

trypsin.definition: pancreatic enzyme that activates chymotrypsin and digests protein

urea cycle.definition: process that converts potentially toxic nitrogen waste into urea that can be eliminated through the kidneys

vitamins.definition: organic compounds required by the body to perform biochemical reactions like metabolism and bone, cell, and tissue growth

anatomical sphincter.definition: smooth or skeletal muscle surrounding the lumen of a vessel or hollow organ that can restrict flow when contracted

angiotensin I.definition: protein produced by the enzymatic action of renin on angiotensinogen; inactive precursor of angiotensin II

angiotensin II.definition: protein produced by the enzymatic action of ACE on inactive angiotensin I; actively causes vasoconstriction and stimulates aldosterone release by the adrenal cortex

angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE).definition: enzyme produced by the lungs that catalyzes the reaction of inactive angiotensin I into active angiotensin II

angiotensinogen.definition: inactive protein in the circulation produced by the liver; precursor of angiotensin I; must be modified by the enzymes renin and ACE to be activated

anuria.definition: absence of urine produced; production of 50 mL or less per day

aquaporin.definition: protein-forming water channels through the lipid bilayer of the cell; allows water to cross; activation in the collecting ducts is under the control of ADH

Bowman\u00e2\u0080\u0099s capsule.definition: cup-shaped sack lined by a simple squamous epithelium (parietal surface) and specialized cells called podocytes (visceral surface) that participate in the filtration process; receives the filtrate which then passes on to the PCTs

brush border.definition: formed by microvilli on the surface of certain cuboidal cells; in the kidney it is found in the PCT; increases surface area for absorption in the kidney

calyces.definition: cup-like structures receiving urine from the collecting ducts where it passes on to the renal pelvis and ureter

cortical nephrons.definition: nephrons with loops of Henle that do not extend into the renal medulla

countercurrent multiplier system.definition: involves the descending and ascending loops of Henle directing forming urine in opposing directions to create a concentration gradient when combined with variable permeability and sodium pumping

detrusor muscle.definition: smooth muscle in the bladder wall; fibers run in all directions to reduce the size of the organ when emptying it of urine

distal convoluted tubules.definition: portions of the nephron distal to the loop of Henle that receive hyposmotic filtrate from the loop of Henle and empty into collecting ducts

diuretic.definition: compound that increases urine output, leading to decreased water conservation

efferent arteriole.definition: arteriole carrying blood from the glomerulus to the capillary beds around the convoluted tubules and loop of Henle; portion of the portal system

endothelins.definition: group of vasoconstrictive, 21-amino acid peptides; produced by endothelial cells of the renal blood vessels, mesangial cells, and cells of the DCT

external urinary sphincter.definition: skeletal muscle; must be relaxed consciously to void urine

fenestrations.definition: small windows through a cell, allowing rapid filtration based on size; formed in such a way as to allow substances to cross through a cell without mixing with cell contents

filtration slits.definition: formed by pedicels of podocytes; substances filter between the pedicels based on size

forming urine.definition: filtrate undergoing modifications through secretion and reabsorption before true urine is produced

glomerulus.definition: tuft of capillaries surrounded by Bowmanâs capsule; filters the blood based on size

glycosuria.definition: presence of glucose in the urine; caused by high blood glucose levels that exceed the ability of the kidneys to reabsorb the glucose; usually the result of untreated or poorly controlled diabetes mellitus

incontinence.definition: loss of ability to control micturition

intercalated cell.definition: specialized cell of the collecting ducts that secrete or absorb acid or bicarbonate; important in acidâbase balance

internal urinary sphincter.definition: smooth muscle at the juncture of the bladder and urethra; relaxes as the bladder fills to allow urine into the urethra

inulin.definition: plant polysaccharide injected to determine GFR; is neither secreted nor absorbed by the kidney, so its appearance in the urine is directly proportional to its filtration rate

juxtaglomerular apparatus (JGA).definition: located at the juncture of the DCT and the afferent and efferent arterioles of the glomerulus; plays a role in the regulation of renal blood flow and GFR

juxtaglomerular cell.definition: modified smooth muscle cells of the afferent arteriole; secretes renin in response to a drop in blood pressure

juxtamedullary nephrons.definition: nephrons adjacent to the border of the cortex and medulla with loops of Henle that extend into the renal medulla

leaky tight junctions.definition: tight junctions in which the sealing strands of proteins between the membranes of adjacent cells are fewer in number and incomplete; allows limited intercellular movement of solvent and solutes

leukocyte esterase.definition: enzyme produced by leukocytes that can be detected in the urine and that serves as an indirect indicator of urinary tract infection

loop of Henle.definition: descending and ascending portions between the proximal and distal convoluted tubules; those of cortical nephrons do not extend into the medulla, whereas those of juxtamedullary nephrons do extend into the medulla

macula densa.definition: cells found in the part of the DCT forming the JGA; sense Na+concentration in the forming urine

medulla.definition: inner region of kidney containing the renal pyramids

mesangial.definition: contractile cells found in the glomerulus; can contract or relax to regulate filtration rate

myogenic mechanism.definition: mechanism by which smooth muscle responds to stretch by contracting; an increase in blood pressure causes vasoconstriction and a decrease in blood pressure causes vasodilation so that blood flow downstream remains steady

nephrons.definition: functional units of the kidney that carry out all filtration and modification to produce urine; consist of renal corpuscles, proximal and distal convoluted tubules, and descending and ascending loops of Henle; drain into collecting ducts

net filtration pressure (NFP).definition: pressure of fluid across the glomerulus; calculated by taking the hydrostatic pressure of the capillary and subtracting the colloid osmotic pressure of the blood and the hydrostatic pressure of Bowmanâs capsule

oliguria.definition: below normal urine production of 400â500 mL/day

osteomalacia.definition: softening of bones due to a lack of mineralization with calcium and phosphate; most often due to lack of vitamin D; in children, osteomalacia is termed rickets; not to be confused with osteoporosis

pedicels.definition: finger-like projections of podocytes surrounding glomerular capillaries; interdigitate to form a filtration membrane

peritubular capillaries.definition: second capillary bed of the renal portal system; surround the proximal and distal convoluted tubules; associated with the vasa recta

physiological sphincter.definition: sphincter consisting of circular smooth muscle indistinguishable from adjacent muscle but possessing differential innervations, permitting its function as a sphincter; structurally weak

podocytes.definition: cells forming finger-like processes; form the visceral layer of Bowmanâs capsule; pedicels of the podocytes interdigitate to form a filtration membrane

polyuria.definition: urine production in excess of 2.5 L/day; may be caused by diabetes insipidus, diabetes mellitus, or excessive use of diuretics

principal cell.definition: found in collecting ducts and possess channels for the recovery or loss of sodium and potassium; under the control of aldosterone; also have aquaporin channels under ADH control to regulate recovery of water

proximal convoluted tubules (PCTs).definition: tortuous tubules receiving filtrate from Bowmanâs capsule; most active part of the nephron in reabsorption and secretion

renal columns.definition: extensions of the renal cortex into the renal medulla; separates the renal pyramids; contains blood vessels and connective tissues

renal corpuscle.definition: consists of the glomerulus and Bowmanâs capsule

renal cortex.definition: outer part of kidney containing all of the nephrons; some nephrons have loops of Henle extending into the medulla

renal fat pad.definition: adipose tissue between the renal fascia and the renal capsule that provides protective cushioning to the kidney

renal hilum.definition: recessed medial area of the kidney through which the renal artery, renal vein, ureters, lymphatics, and nerves pass

renal papillae.definition: medullary area of the renal pyramids where collecting ducts empty urine into the minor calyces

renal pyramids.definition: six to eight cone-shaped tissues in the medulla of the kidney containing collecting ducts and the loops of Henle of juxtamedullary nephrons

renin.definition: enzyme produced by juxtaglomerular cells in response to decreased blood pressure or sympathetic nervous activity; catalyzes the conversion of angiotensinogen into angiotensin I

retroperitoneal.definition: behind the peritoneum; in the case of the kidney and ureters, between the parietal peritoneum and the abdominal wall

sacral micturition center.definition: group of neurons in the sacral region of the spinal cord that controls urination; acts reflexively unless its action is modified by higher brain centers to allow voluntary urination

specific gravity.definition: weight of a liquid compared to pure water, which has a specific gravity of 1.0; any solute added to water will increase its specific gravity

systemic edema.definition: increased fluid retention in the interstitial spaces and cells of the body; can be seen as swelling over large areas of the body, particularly the lower extremities

trigone.definition: area at the base of the bladder marked by the two ureters in the posteriorâlateral aspect and the urethral orifice in the anterior aspect oriented like points on a triangle

tubuloglomerular feedback.definition: feedback mechanism involving the JGA; macula densa cells monitor Na+concentration in the terminal portion of the ascending loop of Henle and act to cause vasoconstriction or vasodilation of afferent and efferent arterioles to alter GFR

urethra.definition: transports urine from the bladder to the outside environment

urinalysis.definition: analysis of urine to diagnose disease

urochrome.definition: heme-derived pigment that imparts the typical yellow color of urine

vasa recta.definition: branches of the efferent arterioles that parallel the course of the loops of Henle and are continuous with the peritubular capillaries; with the glomerulus, form a portal system

antidiuretic hormone (ADH).definition: also known as vasopressin, a hormone that increases the volume of water reabsorbed from the collecting tubules of the kidney

dehydration.definition: state of containing insufficient water in blood and other tissues

dihydroxyvitamin D.definition: active form of vitamin D required by the intestinal epithelial cells for the absorption of calcium

extracellular fluid (ECF).definition: fluid exterior to cells; includes the interstitial fluid, blood plasma, and fluids found in other reservoirs in the body

fluid compartment.definition: fluid inside all cells of the body constitutes a compartment system that is largely segregated from other systems

hydrostatic pressure.definition: pressure exerted by a fluid against a wall, caused by its own weight or pumping force

hypercalcemia.definition: abnormally increased blood levels of calcium

hypercapnia.definition: abnormally elevated blood levels of CO2

hypernatremia.definition: abnormal increase in blood sodium levels

hypocalcemia.definition: abnormally low blood levels of calcium

hypocapnia.definition: abnormally low blood levels of CO2

hypokalemia.definition: abnormally decreased blood levels of potassium

hyponatremia.definition: lower-than-normal levels of sodium in the blood

interstitial fluid (IF).definition: fluid in the small spaces between cells not contained within blood vessels

intracellular fluid (ICF).definition: fluid in the cytosol of cells

metabolic acidosis.definition: condition wherein a deficiency of bicarbonate causes the blood to be overly acidic

metabolic alkalosis.definition: condition wherein an excess of bicarbonate causes the blood to be overly alkaline

plasma osmolality.definition: ratio of solutes to a volume of solvent in the plasma; plasma osmolality reflects a personâs state of hydration

respiratory acidosis.definition: condition wherein an excess of carbonic acid or CO2causes the blood to be overly acidic

respiratory alkalosis.definition: condition wherein a deficiency of carbonic acid/CO2levels causes the blood to be overly alkaline

alveoli.definition: (of the breast) milk-secreting cells in the mammary gland

ampulla.definition: (of the uterine tube) middle portion of the uterine tube in which fertilization often occurs

antrum.definition: fluid-filled chamber that characterizes a mature tertiary (antral) follicle

areola.definition: highly pigmented, circular area surrounding the raised nipple and containing areolar glands that secrete fluid important for lubrication during suckling

Bartholin\u00e2\u0080\u0099s glands.definition: (also, greater vestibular glands) glands that produce a thick mucus that maintains moisture in the vulva area; also referred to as the greater vestibular glands

blood\u00e2\u0080\u0093testis barrier.definition: tight junctions between Sertoli cells that prevent bloodborne pathogens from gaining access to later stages of spermatogenesis and prevent the potential for an autoimmune reaction to haploid sperm

broad ligament.definition: wide ligament that supports the uterus by attaching laterally to both sides of the uterus and pelvic wall

bulbourethral glands.definition: (also, Cowperâs glands) glands that secrete a lubricating mucus that cleans and lubricates the urethra prior to and during ejaculation

cervix.definition: elongate inferior end of the uterus where it connects to the vagina

clitoris.definition: (also, glans clitoris) nerve-rich area of the vulva that contributes to sexual sensation during intercourse

corpus albicans.definition: nonfunctional structure remaining in the ovarian stroma following structural and functional regression of the corpus luteum

corpus cavernosum.definition: (plural = corpora cavernosa) either of two columns of erectile tissue in the penis that fill with blood during an erection

corpus luteum.definition: transformed follicle after ovulation that secretes progesterone

corpus spongiosum.definition: column of erectile tissue in the penis that fills with blood during an erection and surrounds the penile urethra on the ventral portion of the penis

ductus deferens.definition: (also, vas deferens) duct that transports sperm from the epididymis through the spermatic cord and into the ejaculatory duct; also referred as the vas deferens

ejaculatory duct.definition: duct that connects the ampulla of the ductus deferens with the duct of the seminal vesicle at the prostatic urethra

endometrium.definition: inner lining of the uterus, part of which builds up during the secretory phase of the menstrual cycle and then sheds with menses

epididymis.definition: (plural = epididymides) coiled tubular structure in which sperm start to mature and are stored until ejaculation

fimbriae.definition: fingerlike projections on the distal uterine tubes

follicle.definition: ovarian structure of one oocyte and surrounding granulosa (and later theca) cells

folliculogenesis.definition: development of ovarian follicles from primordial to tertiary under the stimulation of gonadotropins

fundus.definition: (of the uterus) domed portion of the uterus that is superior to the uterine tubes

gamete.definition: haploid reproductive cell that contributes genetic material to form an offspring

glans penis.definition: bulbous end of the penis that contains a large number of nerve endings

gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH).definition: hormone released by the hypothalamus that regulates the production of follicle-stimulating hormone and luteinizing hormone from the pituitary gland

gonads.definition: reproductive organs (testes and ovaries) that produce gametes and reproductive hormones

granulosa cells.definition: supportive cells in the ovarian follicle that produce estrogen

hymen.definition: membrane that covers part of the opening of the vagina

infundibulum.definition: (of the uterine tube) wide, distal portion of the uterine tube terminating in fimbriae

inguinal canal.definition: opening in abdominal wall that connects the testes to the abdominal cavity

isthmus.definition: narrow, medial portion of the uterine tube that joins the uterus

labia majora.definition: hair-covered folds of skin located behind the mons pubis

labia minora.definition: thin, pigmented, hairless flaps of skin located medial and deep to the labia majora

lactiferous ducts.definition: ducts that connect the mammary glands to the nipple and allow for the transport of milk

lactiferous sinus.definition: area of milk collection between alveoli and lactiferous duct

Leydig cells.definition: cells between the seminiferous tubules of the testes that produce testosterone; a type of interstitial cell

mammary glands.definition: glands inside the breast that secrete milk

menarche.definition: first menstruation in a pubertal female

menses.definition: shedding of the inner portion of the endometrium out though the vagina; also referred to as menstruation

menses phase.definition: phase of the menstrual cycle in which the endometrial lining is shed

menstrual cycle.definition: approximately 28-day cycle of changes in the uterus consisting of a menses phase, a proliferative phase, and a secretory phase

mons pubis.definition: mound of fatty tissue located at the front of the vulva

M\u00c3\u00bcllerian duct.definition: duct system present in the embryo that will eventually form the internal female reproductive structures

myometrium.definition: smooth muscle layer of uterus that allows for uterine contractions during labor and expulsion of menstrual blood

oocyte.definition: cell that results from the division of the oogonium and undergoes meiosis I at the LH surge and meiosis II at fertilization to become a haploid ovum

oogenesis.definition: process by which oogonia divide by mitosis to primary oocytes, which undergo meiosis to produce the secondary oocyte and, upon fertilization, the ovum

oogonia.definition: ovarian stem cells that undergo mitosis during female fetal development to form primary oocytes

ovarian cycle.definition: approximately 28-day cycle of changes in the ovary consisting of a follicular phase and a luteal phase

ovaries.definition: female gonads that produce oocytes and sex steroid hormones (notably estrogen and progesterone)

ovulation.definition: release of a secondary oocyte and associated granulosa cells from an ovary

ovum.definition: haploid female gamete resulting from completion of meiosis II at fertilization

perimetrium.definition: outer epithelial layer of uterine wall

polar body.definition: smaller cell produced during the process of meiosis in oogenesis

prepuce.definition: (also, foreskin) flap of skin that forms a collar around, and thus protects and lubricates, the glans penis; also referred as the foreskin

primary follicles.definition: ovarian follicles with a primary oocyte and one layer of cuboidal granulosa cells

primordial follicles.definition: least developed ovarian follicles that consist of a single oocyte and a single layer of flat (squamous) granulosa cells

proliferative phase.definition: phase of the menstrual cycle in which the endometrium proliferates

prostate gland.definition: doughnut-shaped gland at the base of the bladder surrounding the urethra and contributing fluid to semen during ejaculation

puberty.definition: life stage during which a male or female adolescent becomes anatomically and physiologically capable of reproduction

rugae.definition: (of the vagina) folds of skin in the vagina that allow it to stretch during intercourse and childbirth

scrotum.definition: external pouch of skin and muscle that houses the testes

secondary follicles.definition: ovarian follicles with a primary oocyte and multiple layers of granulosa cells

secondary sex characteristics.definition: physical characteristics that are influenced by sex steroid hormones and have supporting roles in reproductive function

secretory phase.definition: phase of the menstrual cycle in which the endometrium secretes a nutrient-rich fluid in preparation for implantation of an embryo

semen.definition: ejaculatory fluid composed of sperm and secretions from the seminal vesicles, prostate, and bulbourethral glands

seminal vesicle.definition: gland that produces seminal fluid, which contributes to semen

seminiferous tubules.definition: tube structures within the testes where spermatogenesis occurs

Sertoli cells.definition: cells that support germ cells through the process of spermatogenesis; a type of sustentacular cell

spermatic cord.definition: bundle of nerves and blood vessels that supplies the testes; contains ductus deferens

spermatid.definition: immature sperm cells produced by meiosis II of secondary spermatocytes

spermatocyte.definition: cell that results from the division of spermatogonium and undergoes meiosis I and meiosis II to form spermatids

spermatogenesis.definition: formation of new sperm, occurs in the seminiferous tubules of the testes

spermatogonia.definition: (singular = spermatogonium) diploid precursor cells that become sperm

spermiogenesis.definition: transformation of spermatids to spermatozoa during spermatogenesis

suspensory ligaments.definition: bands of connective tissue that suspend the breast onto the chest wall by attachment to the overlying dermis

tertiary follicles.definition: (also, antral follicles) ovarian follicles with a primary or secondary oocyte, multiple layers of granulosa cells, and a fully formed antrum

theca cells.definition: estrogen-producing cells in a maturing ovarian follicle

uterine tubes.definition: (also, fallopian tubes or oviducts) ducts that facilitate transport of an ovulated oocyte to the uterus

uterus.definition: muscular hollow organ in which a fertilized egg develops into a fetus

vagina.definition: tunnel-like organ that provides access to the uterus for the insertion of semen and from the uterus for the birth of a baby

Wolffian duct.definition: duct system present in the embryo that will eventually form the internal male reproductive structures

acrosomal reaction.definition: release of digestive enzymes by sperm that enables them to burrow through the corona radiata and penetrate the zona pellucida of an oocyte prior to fertilization

acrosome.definition: cap-like vesicle located at the anterior-most region of a sperm that is rich with lysosomal enzymes capable of digesting the protective layers surrounding the oocyte

afterbirth.definition: third stage of childbirth in which the placenta and associated fetal membranes are expelled

allantois.definition: finger-like outpocketing of yolk sac forms the primitive excretory duct of the embryo; precursor to the urinary bladder

allele.definition: alternative forms of a gene that occupy a specific locus on a specific gene

amnion.definition: transparent membranous sac that encloses the developing fetus and fills with amniotic fluid

amniotic cavity.definition: cavity that opens up between the inner cell mass and the trophoblast; develops into amnion

autosomal chromosome.definition: in humans, the 22 pairs of chromosomes that are not the sex chromosomes (XX or XY)

autosomal dominant.definition: pattern of dominant inheritance that corresponds to a gene on one of the 22 autosomal chromosomes

autosomal recessive.definition: pattern of recessive inheritance that corresponds to a gene on one of the 22 autosomal chromosomes

blastocyst.definition: term for the conceptus at the developmental stage that consists of about 100 cells shaped into an inner cell mass that is fated to become the embryo and an outer trophoblast that is fated to become the associated fetal membranes and placenta

Braxton Hicks contractions.definition: weak and irregular peristaltic contractions that can occur in the second and third trimesters; they do not indicate that childbirth is imminent

brown adipose tissue.definition: highly vascularized fat tissue that is packed with mitochondria; these properties confer the ability to oxidize fatty acids to generate heat

capacitation.definition: process that occurs in the female reproductive tract in which sperm are prepared for fertilization; leads to increased motility and changes in their outer membrane that improve their ability to release enzymes capable of digesting an oocyteâs outer layers

carrier.definition: heterozygous individual who does not display symptoms of a recessive genetic disorder but can transmit the disorder to their offspring

chorion.definition: membrane that develops from the syncytiotrophoblast, cytotrophoblast, and mesoderm; surrounds the embryo and forms the fetal portion of the placenta through the chorionic villi

chorionic membrane.definition: precursor to the chorion; forms from extra-embryonic mesoderm cells

chorionic villi.definition: projections of the chorionic membrane that burrow into the endometrium and develop into the placenta

cleavage.definition: form of mitotic cell division in which the cell divides but the total volume remains unchanged; this process serves to produce smaller and smaller cells

codominance.definition: pattern of inheritance that corresponds to the equal, distinct, and simultaneous expression of two different alleles

colostrum.definition: thick, yellowish substance secreted from a motherâs breasts in the first postpartum days; rich in immunoglobulins

conceptus.definition: pre-implantation stage of a fertilized egg and its associated membranes

corona radiata.definition: in an oocyte, a layer of granulosa cells that surrounds the oocyte and that must be penetrated by sperm before fertilization can occur

cortical reaction.definition: following fertilization, the release of cortical granules from the oocyteâs plasma membrane into the zona pellucida creating a fertilization membrane that prevents any further attachment or penetration of sperm; part of the slow block to polyspermy

dilation.definition: first stage of childbirth, involving an increase in cervical diameter

dominant.definition: describes a trait that is expressed both in homozygous and heterozygous form

dominant lethal.definition: inheritance pattern in which individuals with one or two copies of a lethal allele do not survive in utero or have a shortened life span

ductus arteriosus.definition: shunt in the pulmonary trunk that diverts oxygenated blood back to the aorta

ductus venosus.definition: shunt that causes oxygenated blood to bypass the fetal liver on its way to the inferior vena cava

ectoderm.definition: primary germ layer that develops into the central and peripheral nervous systems, sensory organs, epidermis, hair, and nails

ectopic pregnancy.definition: implantation of an embryo outside of the uterus

embryonic folding.definition: process by which an embryo develops from a flat disc of cells to a three-dimensional shape resembling a cylinder

endoderm.definition: primary germ layer that goes on to form the gastrointestinal tract, liver, pancreas, and lungs

epiblast.definition: upper layer of cells of the embryonic disc that forms from the inner cell mass; gives rise to all three germ layers

episiotomy.definition: incision made in the posterior vaginal wall and perineum that facilitates vaginal birth

expulsion.definition: second stage of childbirth, during which the mother bears down with contractions; this stage ends in birth

fertilization.definition: unification of genetic material from male and female haploid gametes

fertilization membrane.definition: impenetrable barrier that coats a nascent zygote; part of the slow block to polyspermy

fetus.definition: developing human during the time from the end of the embryonic period (week 9) to birth

foramen ovale.definition: shunt that directly connects the right and left atria and helps divert oxygenated blood from the fetal pulmonary circuit

foremilk.definition: watery, translucent breast milk that is secreted first during a feeding and is rich in lactose and protein; quenches the infantâs thirst

gastrulation.definition: process of cell migration and differentiation into three primary germ layers following cleavage and implantation

genotype.definition: complete genetic makeup of an individual

gestation.definition: in human development, the period required for embryonic and fetal development in utero; pregnancy

heterozygous.definition: having two different alleles for a given gene

hindmilk.definition: opaque, creamy breast milk delivered toward the end of a feeding; rich in fat; satisfies the infantâs appetite

homozygous.definition: having two identical alleles for a given gene

human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG).definition: hormone that directs the corpus luteum to survive, enlarge, and continue producing progesterone and estrogen to suppress menses and secure an environment suitable for the developing embryo

hypoblast.definition: lower layer of cells of the embryonic disc that extend into the blastocoel to form the yolk sac

implantation.definition: process by which a blastocyst embeds itself in the uterine endometrium

incomplete dominance.definition: pattern of inheritance in which a heterozygous genotype expresses a phenotype intermediate between dominant and recessive phenotypes

inner cell mass.definition: cluster of cells within the blastocyst that is fated to become the embryo

involution.definition: postpartum shrinkage of the uterus back to its pre-pregnancy volume

karyotype.definition: systematic arrangement of images of chromosomes into homologous pairs

lactation.definition: process by which milk is synthesized and secreted from the mammary glands of the postpartum female breast in response to sucking at the nipple

lanugo.definition: silk-like hairs that coat the fetus; shed later in fetal development

let-down reflex.definition: release of milk from the alveoli triggered by infant suckling

lightening.definition: descent of the fetus lower into the pelvis in late pregnancy; also called âdroppingâ

lochia.definition: postpartum vaginal discharge that begins as blood and ends as a whitish discharge; the end of lochia signals that the site of placental attachment has healed

meconium.definition: fetal wastes consisting of ingested amniotic fluid, cellular debris, mucus, and bile

mesoderm.definition: primary germ layer that becomes the skeleton, muscles, connective tissue, heart, blood vessels, and kidneys

morula.definition: tightly packed sphere of blastomeres that has reached the uterus but has not yet implanted itself

mutation.definition: change in the nucleotide sequence of DNA

neural fold.definition: elevated edge of the neural groove

neural plate.definition: thickened layer of neuroepithelium that runs longitudinally along the dorsal surface of an embryo and gives rise to nervous system tissue

neural tube.definition: precursor to structures of the central nervous system, formed by the invagination and separation of neuroepithelium

neurulation.definition: embryonic process that establishes the central nervous system

nonshivering thermogenesis.definition: process of breaking down brown adipose tissue to produce heat in the absence of a shivering response

notochord.definition: rod-shaped, mesoderm-derived structure that provides support for growing fetus

organogenesis.definition: development of the rudimentary structures of all of an embryoâs organs from the germ layers

phenotype.definition: physical or biochemical manifestation of the genotype; expression of the alleles

placenta.definition: organ that forms during pregnancy to nourish the developing fetus; also regulates waste and gas exchange between mother and fetus

placenta previa.definition: low placement of fetus within uterus causes placenta to partially or completely cover the opening of the cervix as it grows

placentation.definition: formation of the placenta; complete by weeks 14â16 of pregnancy

polyspermy.definition: penetration of an oocyte by more than one sperm

primitive streak.definition: indentation along the dorsal surface of the epiblast through which cells migrate to form the endoderm and mesoderm during gastrulation

prolactin.definition: pituitary hormone that establishes and maintains the supply of breast milk; also important for the mobilization of maternal micronutrients for breast milk

Punnett square.definition: grid used to display all possible combinations of alleles transmitted by parents to offspring and predict the mathematical probability of offspring inheriting a given genotype

quickening.definition: fetal movements that are strong enough to be felt by the mother

recessive.definition: describes a trait that is only expressed in homozygous form and is masked in heterozygous form

recessive lethal.definition: inheritance pattern in which individuals with two copies of a lethal allele do not survive in utero or have a shortened life span

sex chromosomes.definition: pair of chromosomes involved in sex determination; in males, the XY chromosomes; in females, the XX chromosomes

shunt.definition: circulatory shortcut that diverts the flow of blood from one region to another

somite.definition: one of the paired, repeating blocks of tissue located on either side of the notochord in the early embryo

syncytiotrophoblast.definition: superficial cells of the trophoblast that fuse to form a multinucleated body that digests endometrial cells to firmly secure the blastocyst to the uterine wall

trimester.definition: division of the duration of a pregnancy into three 3-month terms

trophoblast.definition: fluid-filled shell of squamous cells destined to become the chorionic villi, placenta, and associated fetal membranes

true labor.definition: regular contractions that immediately precede childbirth; they do not abate with hydration or rest, and they become more frequent and powerful with time

umbilical cord.definition: connection between the developing conceptus and the placenta; carries deoxygenated blood and wastes from the fetus and returns nutrients and oxygen from the mother

vernix caseosa.definition: waxy, cheese-like substance that protects the delicate fetal skin until birth

X-linked.definition: pattern of inheritance in which an allele is carried on the X chromosome of the 23rd pair

X-linked dominant.definition: pattern of dominant inheritance that corresponds to a gene on the X chromosome of the 23rd pair

X-linked recessive.definition: pattern of recessive inheritance that corresponds to a gene on the X chromosome of the 23rd pair

yolk sac.definition: membrane associated with primitive circulation to the developing embryo; source of the first blood cells and germ cells and contributes to the umbilical cord structure

zona pellucida.definition: thick, gel-like glycoprotein membrane that coats the oocyte and must be penetrated by sperm before fertilization can occur

zygote.definition: fertilized egg; a diploid cell resulting from the fertilization of haploid gametes from the male and female lines
